cleaned_text: What is Ayurveda? Ayurveda is a medical system from India that is used around the world. Herbs are used in Ayurvedic remedies to promote health or treat disease. These remedies come from Ayurvedic practitioners, from stores or on line, and from the United States and other countries. Example of Ayurvedic Pill Lead in Ayurveda Some Ayurvedic remedies have lead and other heavy metals like arsenic and mercury. People have become poisoned from using these types of remedies. Ayurvedic remedies and supplements are not evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for safety or quality. Example of Ayurvedic Pill What is lead poisoning? Lead is harmful to the human body, especially for children and pregnant women. Lead can harm the brain, and make it hard for children to learn, pay attention, and behave. A person with lead poisoning may not look or feel sick. Even when a person has no symptoms, lead can harm the kidneys, increase the chances of having a miscarriage, increase blood pressure, and cause death from heart attack or stroke. The only way to know if you have lead in your body is with a blood test for lead. What should I do? Kesaria Balguti Talk to your doctor before taking any Ayurvedic remedies. It is very important to tell your doctor about any herbal products or other remedies you may be taking, especially if you have abdominal pain, nausea, or fatigue. If you think that you or a family member may have been exposed to lead, it is important to see a doctor right away.
